definition:
Mimicking the Lusternik-Schnirelmann category invariant for a smooth
manifold $M$ we can ask about the minimal number of critical loops of
smooth scalar maps $M\to\mathbb{R}$ which are round functions, that is
functions whose critical points are aligned in a disjoint union of
closed curves (a link).

This number is called the [**round complexity**]{} of $M$ and it is
symbolized as ${\rm roc}(M)$

Then
$${\rm roc}(M)=\min\#\{\mbox{critical loops of\quad}f\quad|\quad f\colon M \to\mathbb{R}\quad \mbox{is round function}\}$$

This concept is related to the invariant called t-cat.

Theorem 1: [*The round complexity for the 2-torus and the Klein bottle
is two; all the other closed surfaces have a round complexity of
three.*]{}

Theorem 2: [*For each closed manifold, $t-cat\le roc$*]{}

[**Bibliography**]{}

D. Siersma, G. Khimshiasvili, On minimal round functions, Preprint 1118,
Department of Mathematics, Utrecht University, 1999, pp. 18.
